sentence: Now trading at just above cash backing.
ELR is now trading at only just above its MarQ12 cash backing level of $0.23/sh.
We believe that the enterprise value of ELR is worth more than zero, so we have taken the opportunity to revisit the ELR valuation story.
According to GFMS's recent 2011 all-in cost curve, around 75-80% of the industry is underwater at the current platinum price of around US$1425/oz.
We are therefore fairly confident that something has to change.

ELR is not for the risk averse investor - its balance sheet capacity dictates that it may have to provide a supply response before its larger peers, but when the resource base can be acquired for an EV of almost nothing we believe ELR is an attractive option on the platinum market.
The current Crocodile River Mine ( CRM ) is a marginal operation at the best of times, and in the current environment is unquestionably bleeding cash.

However, there are two bright spots on the horizon: 1) the vertical shaft transition at CRM has the potential to increase EBITDA by around $23mn (~ 2.5cps in earnings) and our analysis suggests that consensus is not reflecting this, and 2) the expected 2013 ramp up of the Eastern Limb project should improve operating margins substantially.
At March 31 2012, ELR had cash (and equivalents) worth $213mn, or $0.23/share.
Our global valuation heat map provides some fairly detailed earnings, yield/return, and balance sheet based comps for our global coverage universe.

Mineral inventory comps (reserve / resources) are included later in the full report
